# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # split the md string into an array of lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    
    # initialize an empty code block to store the extracted code
    code_block = ""
    
    # loop through each line of the md file
    for line in lines
        # check if the current line starts with a triple backtick (code fence)
        if startswith(line, "```")
            # if so, append the code block to the previous code block
            code_block *= "\n" * strip(line[4:end])
            
            # if there is no more code after this line, break out of the loop
            if endswith(line, "```")
                break
            end
        else
            # if the current line does not start with a triple backtick, append it to the code block
            code_block *= "\n" * strip(line)
        end
    end
    
    # return the extracted code block as a string
    return code_block
end
```
